metadata.title: CVE-2022-23960 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Certain Arm Cortex and Neoverse processors through 2022-03-08 do notproperly restrict cache speculation, aka Spectre-BHB. An attacker canleverage the shared branch history in the Branch History Buffer (BHB) toinfluence mispredicted branches. Then, cache allocation can allow theattacker to obtain sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1133-aws - 4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-oracle - 4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
